SEARCH
Module OOP
Package OOPProject

Interface UserAuthentication

public interface UserAuthentication
Interface defining user authentication operations for the hospital management system. Provides methods for login, password management, and logout functionalities.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    changePassword(String hospitalID, String oldPassword, String newPassword)
    Changes the password for the user with the specified hospital ID.
    void
    forgotPassword(String hospitalID)
    Handles the "forgot password" process for the user with the specified hospital ID.
    boolean
    login(String hospitalID, String password)
    Logs in a user with the specified hospital ID and password.
    boolean
    logOut(String hospitalID)
    Logs out the user with the specified hospital ID.

  • Method Details

    • login

      boolean login(String hospitalID, String password)
      Logs in a user with the specified hospital ID and password.
      Parameters:
      hospitalID - the hospital ID of the user.
      password - the password of the user.
      Returns:
      true if login is successful, false otherwise.

    • changePassword

      void changePassword(String hospitalID, String oldPassword, String newPassword)
      Changes the password for the user with the specified hospital ID.
      Parameters:
      hospitalID - the hospital ID of the user.
      oldPassword - the current password of the user.
      newPassword - the new password to be set.

    • forgotPassword

      void forgotPassword(String hospitalID)
      Handles the "forgot password" process for the user with the specified hospital ID. Typically involves sending a password reset link or providing a mechanism for recovery.
      Parameters:
      hospitalID - the hospital ID of the user.

    • logOut

      boolean logOut(String hospitalID)
      Logs out the user with the specified hospital ID.
      Parameters:
      hospitalID - the hospital ID of the user.
      Returns:
      true if logout is successful, false otherwise.
